resources.string: Krakow is a millennial city. Within this place that has survived plague, fires, flood, wars, you will surely find something to your liking. In the recent years the city has opened up to the world and Europe, and is now a place many foreigners call home. It provides a wide offer of international cuisine, all of this in a city that counts about 800k citizen. Quite dense! \n \nSo how to get started? well, let\'s start by dragging our navigation drawer from the left to the right. You will enjoy 4 categories: Eat, Drink, Dance, and Oh Really. The latter will offer you a wide choice of surprising facts. So, what are you waiting for? Go visit!
This place is perfect for families.
Come in white, get out colored
Pigeons on the market are former soldiers, waiting to be paid by the dead king.
This shackle used to be fashionable. In another galaxy.
Those lamps were warning passingbyers that this was the grave caused by the Black Death.
The river used to have two arms, merging downtown. To prevent diseases, this branch was dried out a long time ago.
For the lovers of colorful drinks.
Because non-alcoholic doesn\'t have to be boring.
This place is not only friendly, it also serves a wide offer of fresh and tasty meals.
This Kebab is held by an italian with a terrible sense of humor. But the food is decent.
The temple of pizzas! Ask for the prosciutto, you will get a free dessert.
